text:
this may be already done - I hope it has.  The internet is running out of TCP/IPv4 addresses and will be full up in 3 years according to a London report.

this means support for ip addresses with 6 numbers separated by periods if I am not mistaken.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6

there are also some rather unusual addressing methods defined, including one that involvdes hexadecimal...
http://[2001:0db8:85a3:08d3:1319:8a2e:0370:7348]/.

you can even address the individual ethernet card with a %eth0 near the end.

frankly, I don't see any configuration examples that include IPv6.
it is now July 2008.
